knowledge: Common cold Common cold The symptoms of the common cold usually begin two to three days after infection and last 7 to 10 days.  Symptoms include a cough, sore throat, runny nose, sneezing, and fever, which usually resolve in seven to ten days.  In children, the cough lasts for more than 10 days in 35-40% of cases and continues for more than 25 days in 10%.  Symptoms may be more severe in adults.  There are more than 200 different viruses that can cause a cold, so people are unlikely to build up resistance to all of them.  Rhinoviruses cause 30-80% of colds, coronaviruses cause 10%, and respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) causes 10%.  In total, there are about 200 viruses that cause colds Common cold Common cold
